The organization responsible
for the Pitcairn Autogiro
The Pitcairn Autogiro is made by a company
with a long and successful record in the aircraft
industry. Beginning with the early Pitcairn
Orowings, through the Piteairn Mailwing air-
mail successes, down to the present Pitcairn
Tandem all Pitcairn products earned their
reputation for excellence in design, material and
craftsmanship. The Pitcairn plant is manned
a pers

PITCAIRN FIELD. WILLOW GROVE. PA.

what the prwate owner

In nearly thirty years of existence, the airplane has not
made flying as commonplace as predicted. In compari-
son with the millions who operate automobiles, only a
few operate airplanes, and those largely for mail and
transport, or military use.
Ten years ago, Juan de la Cierva foresaw a new oppor-
tunity for growth in the field of aviation. He saw that
The Pitcairn Tandem, after landing on the lawn of a country
home. ready for take.off with a passenger
LANDING
more speed per horse-power.
General specifications. Fuselage: Weight empty, 1310
Ibs.; Gross weight, 1900 Ibs.; Useful load, 590 Ibs.;
Length of Ship, 19 ft. 5 ins.; Span of Ship, 21 ft.; Wing
area, 57.6 sq. ft.; Ground height (clearance to rotor
hub), 10 ft. 6½ ins. Rotor: Diameter, 40 ft.: Blade
area, 106.5 sq. ft.; Disc area, 1260 sq. ft. Power plant:
Engine, 160 h.p.; Gasoline capacity, 30 gals.; Oil
capacity, 3½ gals. Equipment: Combination pump
and gravity fuel system with wobble pump; Dual con.
trols; Motor starter; Cockpit primer; Metal propeller;
Roller-bearing semi-low-pressure wheels; Parkingbrakes;
Tail wheel and landing gear with Oleo shock absorbers;
Fire extinguisher; Navigation lights; Leather uphol.
stery; Safety glass windshields front and rear cockpits:
Full complement of necessary instruments including
compass; Cadmium plated fittings.
PITCAIRN AIRCRAFT, INC.
PITCAIRN FIELD, WILLOW GROVE, PA.
PITCAIRN
autogiro
